values:
Goddammit, Brodie.  Youre an emotional trainwreck.

Get help.



Oh yeah.
Happy Halloween.

It was around 80 degrees outside that night a few weeks ago.  It was 11 at night... and 80 degrees?  Can you believe it?  That was strange enough, but even stranger... I was outside.  I dont know why I was.  I never go outside let alone at 11 at night.
I stood out in the middle of the yard... just staring up at the sky.  The stars.  I breathed in the air.  It was different.  Refreshing.  It was a lot nicer going down into my lungs than the air in my room.  I spend all my time there.  The outside air was almost foreign to me.
Staring at the stars fills me with this interesting feeling inside.  I sprawled my arms out and fell backwards into the yard.  There wasnt even any evening dew.  The grass was dry.  The peepers were peeping and the crickets were chirping.

I just laid there... and I thought.

What a fucking mess youve gotten yourself into, Brodie.
Why are all these people asking you to smile?
The world does not stop turning for you.
Some peoples lives are better without you in them.  This is something you have to learn.
Your sister got away, why cant you?
What would getting away fix?  You would still have the same emotional problems, just in a different area.
Your mother probably thinks you hate her.  You just sit in your room all day and never come out.
Where would you be without your friends?
Why do you insist on digging yourself into an emotional hole that seems impossible to climb out of?
Why do you bank so much on finding a girl?
Why arent you being accepted into any of the jobs you apply for?
What have you really got to live for?  You come home, sit and watch netflix, sleep, work.  Repeat.
You really need an outlet for this shit.
Why does no one seem to care?
What the fuck did you do to mess it up so bad, Brodie?  It was going so well.



Did she ever even have time to hurt?



I could feel them coming on.  Something I dont feel often.  Tears.  Now wouldnt be an exception.

You hate your life and you need help.

And with that I stood up... dragging me feet.
When I came back into the house it was like I was in some sort of emotional bubble.  I was numb in every sense of the word.  And empty spirit.  A zombie.  It was as if I didnt really exist.  It was the most bizarre feeling I have ever had in my entire life.

I was out there, lying in the grass, staring at the sky, thinking... for over an hour.
Im so tired of this.
So so tired of this.

Originally posted August 25, 2005:

You ever been out fishing, and you catch a fish that you really, really like, but you have to let it go?

I caught me a fish I really like. I look at the water. I look at the fish. I look at my cooler. I look at the fish again. I sit down and stare into the fishs eyes...

"Im sorry, fishy. I really like you, so Im not gonna let you go. Im gonna keep ya."

I placed the fish into my cooler. I was worried for that fish, though. If I spent too long out there on the lake, that fish might die in the cooler. I couldnt help but think about that poor fish every minute.
I stood up and grabbed the cooler. I opened the lid to see the fish in my cooler. I bit my lip in thought.


What should I do?
Should I let my fishy go?
Should I keep it in my cooler and hang on to it?


I sat down with the cooler and closed the lid. I glared at down at it for a while. I shook my head.






"Fishy" I said... "I just dont want to let you go"

May 23, 2009

The fisherman decided to hold onto his fish.  In fact, they held eachothers company for about 3 long years.  Then, one day, while the fisherman was relaxing in his boat, the fish opened the cooler and jumped into the sea.

"Fish!  Fishy, come back!" He begged.

He leaped up and and reached over the edge of his boat, desperately clawing at the water.  But it was too late.  Fishy was gone.  He slumped over and started to cry.

The fisherman went hungry.

It was many months before the fisherman could bring himself to fish once more.  After his prized fishy left him, he lost all joy.  Fisherman do not like to fish when they are unhappy.

While fishing, he sometimes saw his first, dear fishy swimming in the sea.  It brought great pain to see fishy.  And the pain was even greater when he thought of fishy with another fisherman.  He knew fishy was happy, and it filled his heart with agony.  Some day, fishy will go far away, to another part of the sea, with her new fisherman.  Fishy would be happy, and he would remain sad.  It brought tears to his eyes every time he thought of this.

Then... one day, purely by coincidence, he met another fish.
"I have heard of you, you fish." said the fisherman.  The fish smiled coyly at him.  It was a vicious smile, but the fisherman liked it.  It was a smile that almost seemed to say "Go ahead, fisherman.  You may want me, but you will not have me.  I will fight you, fisherman.  You are bruised and battered and hungry from your last fish."

The fisherman cast out his line and the fish snagged on.  The fisherman battled with the evasive fish.  The water thrashed and the boat rocked as the fisherman grunted and wrestled his pole.  The fish started to come towards to boat.  The fisherman smiled and gritted his teeth.  Almost there.  The fish was no longer fighting hard.

"I have done it.  I have captured this fish!"  A sharp grin came upon his face.

Then... without warning... the line snapped!  The fisherman tumbled backwards and landed on his back.  The fish swam away, laughing at him.

"How can this be?!" he thought.  "I was using my strongest fishing line, and I thought things were going so well."

In a fit of despair and anger, the fisherman heaved his rod into the sea.  He had found another fish, and lost it.  And he had no idea what happened.  He was really starting to like that fish.  He was a wise fisherman, though, and knew he had been defeated.  He would never have a chance with that fish ever again, but by Christ... he sure wanted one.

"I will just lay here and starve to death..." woed the fisherman.  He laid down in the boat and covered his face with his hat.

And the fisherman went hungry.

I was looking for my All-in-One printer software disc when I found this.
It was tucked away neatly in a basket on the bottom of my shelf.
I had totally forgotten about it, and it was a shock to find it.
It does not have a smudge or a wrinkle in it.

"Dear Brodie,
I am writing this letter to express my love for you.  If you ever have any doubts about my feelings for you, just read this.
You are the best thing thats happened to me in a long time.  I think about you constantly.  I cannot wait until summer when I can spend every day and night with you.
I love the days when we lay in bed together.  I could get lost in your blue eyes forever.  I think about what the future holds for us as I run my fingers through your hair.  There is no where else I would rather be and no one else I would rather be with.
Everytime I am in a store or just out with my friends, something reminds me of you and I want to get it for you to let you know Ive been thinking about you.
I know we dont have much in common, but that is fine with me.  If we liked all the same things, then there would be no excitement, no cute arguments, and no conversations.  Opposites attract Brodie, and we couldnt be more different.
I love how you are so open and understanding with me.  My crankiness can be quite ridiculous and unnecessary, but you put up with it.  You always seem to know what Im thinking or how Im feeling.
You are also very patient with me.  I know that "Fortress Gina" can be stubborn and cause you to think I dont want to be open with you, but it couldnt be further from the truth.
I want to tell you everything.  I want to be with you always.  I want to love you forever.  And I know we will be together as long as we both keep trying to make this work.  I love what we have and I couldnt be happier.  Please Brodie, believe me when I tell you that I love you more than anyone else.  You are everything to me and I would be lost without you.

And now I will leave you with a list of reasons why I love Brodie Lee Young.

Why I Love Brodie Lee Young
1. You take care of me.
2. My friends love you.
3. You would do anything for me
4. I can tell you anything
5. You put up with my dorkiness
6. You put up with my crankiness
7. You are the only one who is just as silly as I am
8. You make me feel loved
9. I am comfortable around you
10. You make me feel like Im the only girl you want to be with

Love Always,
Gina"


I just want to die.
I cant take this anymore :(
My heart hurts so bad.
Why does this have to be happening?

Have you ever woke up and the morning and it felt like something was not right in your life?  Almost like something was out of place or missing?  Almost as if something is not the way it is supposed to be?

I have.
Every single morning.  :(

Last night I had a dream.
It was a dream about my funeral.
No one came to it.






It was the saddest dream I have ever had.

Remember that bitter handicapped kid I talked about 2 years ago? 
If you dont, here is a link: http://master-brodie.livejournal.com/141540.html

He died this morning of natural causes...
I wonder if he was bitter until the bitter end....

My condolences.

Ive come to the conclusion that I just cant be happy anymore.
Ryan was up all weekend and I still wasnt happy.

Thats how I know that Im passed that point.
Im there again, and its the worst place I could possibly be at the start of a new semester.

Its now obvious more than ever that Im not wanted around.
Im not braindead.
And truth is, with the way I feel, I dont want to be around.
Im done.
Im finished.
Im done with holding on, and Im done with trying to work it out.

I hate this.

I hate my life.
I could care less if I woke up in the morning.

My mom called me tonight to inform me that a childhood friend is in critical condition after being nearly stabbed to death.  Her stepdad, who stepped in the way of her attacker, was stabbed in the neck and the head.  He was killed.

Its nuts.  He was such a nice guy.  I guess the motivation was some sort of love triangle?  I dunno.  But I had a crush on this girl from third grade up until sixth grade.  She even tried to start someting with me senior year, but I told her she was about six years too late.  Now that just seems harsh.

MY NAME IS BRODIE YOUNG AND I HAVE LYCANTHROPE.




ON FULL MOONS MY NAILS GROW LONG AND POINTY.

I just got back from the midnight showing of CLOVERFIELD.

This review will be spoiler free.

Now, let me inform you:  Cloverfield did not exceed my expectations in any way.  Cloverfield did not disappoint me.  Cloverfield gave me exactly what I wanted.  Cloverfield fucking delivered.
There is this misconception that Cloverfield is a movie about a giant monster rampaging through New York City.  This is true, to some extent.  In fact, Cloverfield is a love story.  It just happens that there is a giant monster rampaging through New York City in the middle of this love story.
I will get to the meat and bones of what everyone wants to know about:  the creature.  It simply cannot be explained.  All of that concept art you have seen can be thrown out the window.  How this creature has managed to stay secret is beyond me.  The creature is not Cthulu, the creature is not Godzilla.  This creature is like nothing you have ever seen before.  It doesnt even seem to have any borrowed designs.
I feel sorry for any director that wants to make a giant monster movie.  After this movie, the stakes have to be raised.  My mind cannot comprehend any imaginable way that this movie can be outdone.  No movie I have ever seen puts its viewers in the middle of the movie like Cloverfield does.  You really feel that you are in the midst of the chaos.
The movie has no music at all.  So the director came up with all sorts of creative ways to create tension.  He does a very good job of it.  The one song that is in the movie (other than the party scene) happens in the credits.  That song is almost as epic as the creature!
This movie just blew my mind.  Before heading into this movie, I was a bit skeptical.  JJ Abrams is so far up his own ass, that I felt discouraged at times.  But, my worries were meaningless.  This movie lived up to everything I had in mind.  There was no need to "lower my standards" to enjoy the movie.  It was amazing from head to toe.

A bit of a warning, though:  those who get motion sick might not enjoy this movie thoroughly.  I had no problem, personally.  Gina didnt fair too well at points, though.


Bottom line:  GO FUCKING SEE THIS MOVIE.  You wont be disappointed.

I had a pretty titties party on new years.  I was upset that Ryan Dallas couldnt attend, but thats ok.  I will get to party with him on Friday.  Tgray and I played GEARS OF WAR DRINKING GAME.  It was awesome.  It will get you fucked up pretty fast.  You take a shot when:
1. You unlock and achievement
2.  You take out a machine gun nest
3. You chainsaw someone
4. You find a cog tag
5. When you beat a chapter
6. When you kill a Berserker
7. When you die

We had to stop for a while because we took about 7 shots in 5 minutes.  Yeah... Tgray probably would have died.

I have a feeling this semester at school is gonna be overall very boring.

Tori Amos has a new album coming out on May 1st.  It is called AMERICAN DOLL POSSE and the premise for the album is totally fucked up.  Tori has all of these different "dolls" or personalities that come forth in her album.  Each doll has a track or to that they sing.  Yes.  Tori Amos if fucking crazy.  I know...
I have been hesitant to buy it because SCARLETS WALK and THE BEEKEEPER where supremely disappointing to me.
I didnt want to buy it, that is... until I heard <a href="http://www.sonybmgemail.com/arch/Hit?m=qcccom9qt&u=mczmt3">this song clip.</a> 
It is a clip from a song called Bouncing Off Clouds.  You should give it a listen.
Shes taking a whole new direction with this album, and some of her songs sound flat-out like rock songs.
0__________________0

Madness.





Anywho... Im excited for the next semester of my college career.  I have changed my major to Human Services/Social Work.  I think I am going to enjoy it a lot, and all of my teachers have gotten amazing reviews on www.ratemyprofessor.com.
I am not, however, looking forward to this summer.  I dont want to go back to the hospital, especially since it is so shitty and going downhill.  It probably wont be open in another 5 or so years.  Im gonna try to get into Wal-Mart.  I have high ambitions in life...

And despite what Laurel thought she heard, Blue October is NOT playing in Charlotte July. :C
Thats not to say Im not going down, though.  I do, in fact, want to see my sister.  And maybe Blaine and Lauren lol.
Maybe it will just be me, GG, and Gina going down.  Who knows?



Anywho, Gina burnt her finger today and is looking for sympathy.  And she has never seen Lord of the Rings, so we are gonna do that now.




PS:
I finally got around to seeing SIN CITY last night.  Its so much like the novels, it blows my mind.  I was reciting lines before they were even said onscreen.  Crazy.


PPS:
I have no fucking idea why that link I posted earlier isnt working right...

My life is pretty good right now.  I basically gave up on computer science as a whole, so Im totally not going to my programming classes lol.  I know Im hurting my GPA by doing it, but big fuckin deal in my opinion.  I want a major that I actually have some interest in.  I am thinking of taking up human services/social work.  I dunno.  I would like to be a psychologist, but I only wanna go for an associates degree, and HS is the closest thing.

My 21st birthday rocked my goddamn face off.  Thanks to all those who wished me a happy birthday!  My party ruled so hard.  Well, from what I remember of it.  Anywho, I now have an infamous story to tell (and to hear about -_-) anytime Im with my friends.  Lets just say, the story involves a ton of man juice, a sub, and forgetting about a cum covered girlfriend.  Yeah.  Its pretty goddamn embarrassing, but its so fuckin funny.  IM me, I may tell you about it.
I saw a ton of friends that I havent seen in forever, including one Alex Hazen.  I swear to god, if I ever had a mancrush, Alex would be it.  I dont think I have any pictures of him to show you guys.

The new Type O Negative album is fucking mindblowingly amazing.  Seriously, its their best album since Bloody Kisses, and that was like 10 or so years ago.  I suggest you fuckers go buy it now.  If for nothing, just download the song September Sun.  A lot of the album is very October Rust-ish.  That is by no means a bad thing.  They also go back to their thrash metal roots in a few of the songs.

Gina and I havent been spending too much time with eachother as of late.  I mean, it pretty much all has to do with her hating her roommates, and her roommates being total crazies, but I suppose it cant be helped.  After 2 months, things will be back to the way they always used to be.  Come April, we will be together for a year and a half.  Ew.  Gross.  <3

In July I am heading down to North Carolina with GG and maybe some other people to see Laurel.  We have plans to see Blue October in Charolette because they are rumored to be playing there.  I hope the plans are able to go through.

I really dont wanna work at the hospital this summer, but they need me more now than ever, I guess.  Wonderful.  Im hoping I can start back as part time so I dont get shafted out of PTO hours.  I so want a different job.  Maybe I will apply at Wal-Mart or try to get Joan to get me a spot on the tech team.  That would rule so hard, but I am not getting my hopes up.

I also saw 300 and it is easily one of my top 5 movies of all time.  Good Lord that movie had everything.  Sex, violence, story, amazing art style... It was totally awesome.




Anywho, thats sorta my life in a nutshell right nizow.  You bitches should really hit me up more.  I know I know.  IM rarely on AOL anymore, and I rarely even internet, either.  I think I am gonna move back into my dorm, so I should be on the internet more often.  The Elder Scorlls IV: Oblivion is sucking up my spare time, though.  We will see.




Later, d00ds

Ugh.  I have a lot to update about.  I will do it later.  I promise.

Isnt it odd how you can get the best life lessons from the people you have never met before? Im sure its common sense to you all that a physical is required for enterance into a college. Well, I had the privelage of getting my physical with a local Sports Doctor by the name of Dr. Paxson. The man has a bit of a reputation for being zany and kooky. I was skeptical to see him, but he was the only physician available to give me a physical. I can thank my mom for even getting HIM to give me a physical. Anyway... I had the privelage of listening to his entertaining anicdotes as he rolled me around, prodded at my body, examined my muscle structure, and he even put my back into place. He told me about his misadventures as an intern, and he told me all the good things about Edinboro. It was difficult to take him seriously as he belted out these stories. And it didnt help that he dug the earwax from his ear with his golf pencil every so often. After my thrilling and inciteful exam, he gave the chart one last look over. He noticed all the checkmarks I had. Vision: CHECK Lower Back Pain: Check Family History of Heart Problems: Check Depression: Check Family History of Diabetes: Check He suddenly stopped reading. "Whoa whoa whoa, wait... whats the deal with this depression?" He asked while diggin in his ear with his golf pencil. "Well, a couple of years ago, I was depressed over a girl." "Stop right there. I am a doctor. In my eyes, you were not clinically depressed." "I wasnt?" "No. You were heartbroken. There is a difference" he said. "Never confuse depression with heartbreak." I sat there. It had never occured to me. It was so simple. For the past few years I had been telling people I was depressed. I wasnt. It may seem like no big deal to the majority of the people reading this... but for some reason, it was a big deal to me. "Ive been down that road before. I was heartbroken, too. I didnt want to get out of bed, I didnt have an appetite, and I didnt have much motivation to do anything. I gave my all for a girl in college, and she didnt give a crumb back to me. But, I got over it, and Im sure you did, too." He gave me a wink. Well, I did get over it, and it was a good lesson learned. I now have a wonderful, beautiful girlfriend, and she gives me all I need and then some. I really dont know what I would do without her. Next time you see that guy in public... the balding one with the disheveled clothes and the unmatching socks. Yeah... that one... ask him for a life lesson... he might be able to oblige.
